posts.title: The Quiet Revolution of Ordinary Moments
posts.summary: What if peace isn't found in grand spiritual experiences but in the small, seemingly insignificant moments we often overlook?

posts.title: The Unexpected Peace of Unfinished Prayers
posts.summary: What if our stumbling, incomplete prayers are more honest than our polished ones, and what if that's exactly what brings peace to our anxious hearts?

posts.title: The Courage to Be Seen in Process
posts.summary: We often hide our unfinished parts from others, but what if the messy middle of our journey is exactly where authentic connection happens?

posts.title: The Sacred Art of Not Having Answers
posts.summary: In a world obsessed with quick fixes and instant solutions, learning to sit with uncertainty might be the most honest thing we can do for our anxious souls.

posts.title: When Rest Feels Like Rebellion
posts.summary: In a culture that worships productivity, choosing rest can feel like an act of defiance, but perhaps that's exactly what our anxious hearts need.

posts.title: The Gift of Showing Up Empty-Handed
posts.summary: Sometimes the most powerful thing we can bring to community is our emptiness, not our fullness.

posts.title: A Message from Todd
posts.summary: An invitation to intentional Christian community where truth, care, and freedom overcome isolation.
